newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Dow Chemical bid lower.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Dow Chemical bid lower.

text.p: Shares of Dow Chemical Co were bid lower in quiet pre-opening trade Tuesday after a jury found the company was negligent in testing silicone for breast implants.
Traders said Dow was bid at 88-1/2 after being bid as low as 87. The shares closed Monday at 90 and had dropped to 89-1/8 in after-hours trade Monday.
A Louisiana jury ruled against the Midland, Mich., company Monday in a suit alleging the breast implants were dangerous and the company knew it.

Among tech stocks, Microsoft Corp was trading at 133-7/8 from a Monday close of 133-14/16 and semiconductor maker Intel Corp was trading at 95 from a closing price of 94-9/16. MCI Communications Corp was at 34-1/8 from a close of 33-7/8.
Enron Global Power & Pipelines LLC was bid at 34, up from a close of 33-5/16, after Enron Corp said it would merge with the company.
Gillette Co was up at 84-1/2 from a close of 83.
